intro: Galium tsukinanats, commonly known as Japanese bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly rough texture. Galium tsukinanats is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks.
